Description: Mould-made pottery plastic handle broken from the rear of a lamp, decorated with Isis enthroned, suckling Horus; the rear of the throne is indicated by impressed lines; one wing of the throne-back is broken. At the rear is the upper spring of an applied loop handle. Part of the lamp body. Covered with a red-brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2006.bis)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2016, 19 May-27 Nov, BM exhibition Sunken Treasures
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
